info.name: NetLookup
info.comment: Resolve network IP addresses and names using Domain Name Servers.

description.p: Use the NetLookup class for resolving network names to IP addresses and vice versa.
This routine may block temporarily if there are unresolved requests awaiting completion in separate threads.

method.name: BlockingResolveAddress
method.comment: Resolves an IP address to a host name.

input.param: IP address to be resolved, e.g. 123.111.94.82.

description.p: BlockingResolveAddress() performs an IP address resolution, converting an address to an official host name and list of IP addresses. The resolution process requires contact with a DNS server and this will cause the routine to block until a response is received.
The results can be read from the HostName field or received via the Callback function.

result.error: The IP address was resolved successfully.
The address could not be resolved

method.name: BlockingResolveName
method.comment: Resolves a domain name to an official host name and a list of IP addresses.

input.param: The host name to be resolved.

description.p: BlockingResolveName() performs a domain name resolution, converting a domain name to its official host name and IP addresses. The resolution process requires contact with a DNS server and the function will block until a response is received or a timeout occurs.
The results can be read from the Addresses field or received via the Callback function.

result.error: A call to AllocMemory() failed to create a new memory block.

method.name: ResolveAddress
method.comment: Resolves an IP address to a host name.

input.param: IP address to be resolved, e.g. "123.111.94.82".

description.p: ResolveAddress() performs a IP address resolution, converting an address to an official host name and list of IP addresses. The resolution process involves contacting a DNS server. To prevent delays, asynchronous communication is used so that the function can return immediately. The Callback function will be called on completion of the process.
If synchronous (blocking) operation is desired then use the BlockingResolveAddress method.

result.error: The IP address was resolved successfully.
The address could not be resolved

method.name: ResolveName
method.comment: Resolves a domain name to an official host name and a list of IP addresses.

input.param: The host name to be resolved.

description.p: ResolveName() performs a domain name resolution, converting a domain name to an official host name and IP addresses. The resolution process involves contacting a DNS server. To prevent delays, asynchronous communication is used so that the function can return immediately. The Callback function will be called on completion of the process.
If synchronous (blocking) operation is desired then use the BlockingResolveName method.

result.error: A call to AllocMemory() failed to create a new memory block.

description.p: A list of the most recently resolved IP addresses can be read from this field.

field.name: Callback
field.comment: This function will be called on the completion of any name or address resolution.

description.p: The function referenced here will receive the results of the most recently resolved name or address. The C/C++ prototype is Function(*NetLookup, ERROR Error, const std::string &HostName, const std::vector<IPAddress> &Addresses).
The Fluid prototype is as follows, with results readable from the HostName and Addresses fields: function(NetLookup, Error).

field.name: HostName
field.comment: Name of the most recently resolved host.

description.p: The name of the most recently resolved host is readable from this field.

constants.const: Contact the name service and do not use the local DNS cache.
